content.raw:
I added a few more tests in f513af3. The remaining functions are our Qt overwritten functions for receiving mouse events. I tried to generate Qt mouse events for simulating a drag & drop from a variable pill into another one but didn't have any luck. My strategy is:

* Generate a left click event over the first variable pill.
* Generate a mouse move event or multiple from the first variable pill to the second one (with the left button pressed).
* Generate a release button event.

The main problem is that `drag->exec()` blocks my thread after some mouse move events. This happens when the drag mouse event is starting.

I played with other alternatives using a helper QT class where I can have signals, slots and call `QTimer::singleShot()` as other experiments but didn't work either. I'm more than open to suggestions but I ran of ideas at this point. [Here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/branch/plot_2_dragAndDrop) is the branch with some of my experiments in case someone wants to take a look. `VariablePillContainerTest::VariablePillEvents` has the main drag and drop test.
